shortdesc.ph: Enables or disables AI noise reduction and sets the noise reduction mode.
Enables or disables AI noise reduction and sets the noise reduction mode.
Enables or disables AI noise reduction and sets the noise reduction mode.
Enables or disables the AI noise reduction feature and sets the noise reduction mode.

p.codeblock: abstract setAINSMode(enabled: boolean, mode: AudioAinsMode): number;
abstract setAINSMode(enabled: boolean, mode: AudioAinsMode): number;
Future<void> setAINSMode( {required bool enabled, required AudioAinsMode mode});
public abstract int SetAINSMode(bool enabled, AUDIO_AINS_MODE mode);

section.p:
You can call this method to enable AI noise reduction. This feature intelligently detects and reduces various steady and non-steady background noises while preserving voice quality, making speech clearer. Steady noise refers to noise with the same frequency at any point in time. Common examples include:
TV noise
Air conditioner noise
Factory machinery noise Non-steady noise refers to noise that changes rapidly over time. Common examples include:
Thunder
Explosions
Cracking sounds

You can call this method to enable AI noise reduction. This feature intelligently detects and reduces various steady-state and non-steady-state background noises while ensuring voice quality, making the voice clearer. Steady-state noise refers to noise with the same frequency at any point in time. Common steady-state noises include:
TV noise
Air conditioner noise
Factory machinery noise, etc. Non-steady-state noise refers to noise that changes rapidly over time. Common non-steady-state noises include:
Thunder
Explosions
Cracking sounds, etc.

You can call this method to enable the AI noise reduction feature. This feature intelligently detects and reduces various stationary and non-stationary background noises while maintaining voice quality, making human voices clearer. Stationary noise refers to noise with consistent frequency over time, such as:
TV noise
Air conditioner noise
Factory machine noise Non-stationary noise refers to noise that changes rapidly over time, such as:
Thunder
Explosions
Cracking sounds

You can call this method to enable the AI noise reduction feature. This feature intelligently detects and reduces various steady-state and non-steady-state noises in the surrounding environment while ensuring voice quality, making the voice clearer. Steady-state noise refers to noise with the same frequency at any point in time. Common steady-state noises include:
TV noise
Air conditioner noise
Factory machine noise Non-steady-state noise refers to noise that changes rapidly over time. Common non-steady-state noises include:
Thunder
Explosion sounds
Cracking sounds

ul.li: This method depends on the AI noise reduction dynamic library. Removing the dynamic library will cause the feature to fail. For the name of the AI noise reduction dynamic library, see [Plugin List](https://doc.shengwang.cn/doc/rtc/rn/best-practice/reduce-app-size#%E6%8F%92%E4%BB%B6%E5%88%97%E8%A1%A8).
Currently, it is not recommended to enable this feature on devices running Android 6.0 or below.

This method depends on the AI noise reduction dynamic library. Deleting this library will prevent the feature from working properly. For the name of the AI noise reduction library, see [Plugin List](https://doc.shengwang.cn/doc/rtc/flutter/best-practice/reduce-app-size#%E6%8F%92%E4%BB%B6%E5%88%97%E8%A1%A8).
Currently, it is not recommended to enable this feature on devices running Android 6.0 or lower.

This method depends on the AI noise reduction dynamic library. If the library is removed, the feature cannot be enabled properly. See [Plugin List](https://doc.shengwang.cn/doc/rtc/unity/best-practice/reduce-app-size#%E6%8F%92%E4%BB%B6%E5%88%97%E8%A1%A8) for the library name.
It is currently not recommended to enable this feature on devices running Android 6.0 or lower.

section.title: Scenario
section.p: In scenarios such as voice chat, online education, and online meetings, if the surrounding environment is noisy, the AI noise reduction feature can identify and reduce both steady and non-steady noises while preserving voice quality, thereby improving audio quality and user experience.

section.title: Timing
section.p: This method can be called before or after joining a channel.
This method can be called before or after joining the channel.
This method can be called before or after joining a channel.
This method can be called before or after joining a channel.

plentry.pd:
Whether to enable AI noise reduction:
: Enable AI noise reduction.
: (Default) Disable AI noise reduction.

Whether to enable AI noise reduction:
: Enable AI noise reduction.
: (Default) Disable AI noise reduction.

Whether to enable AI noise reduction:
: Enable AI noise reduction.
: (default) Disable AI noise reduction.

Whether to enable the AI noise reduction feature:
: Enable the AI noise reduction feature.
: (Default) Disable the AI noise reduction feature.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
